url.imageAlt: An old sepia photograph of three protesters standing outside the Viscount Hotel with a sign that says “I am a humansexual”
An old photo of a smiling woman sitting on a smiling man’s lap

description: In 1979, the first local issue gay protest in Windsor takes place here due to members of the WGU (Jim Davies and Harold Desmarais) being fired from the Viscount Hotel for being gay. Later in 1982, the first reported case of AIDS and the first reported gay person to die of AIDS in Canada is reported in Windsor at the Hotel Dieu Hospital. He was a 43-year-old gay man.
